p: Some environmental factors reduce the risk of PD, whereas others may raise it. Many natural products, including the phytochemicals present in dietary products, decrease PD development risk (see Section 6). Nutrition might grow to become a preventive and even therapeutic alternative against PD, especially if combined with other interventions like L-3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine (L-DOPA) and its derivatives. However, according to epidemiologic and toxicological data, there is a consistent association between exposure to herbicides, pesticides, and other exogenous toxicants (for example, paraquat or rotenone) and PD [ 23]. Lifestyle factors, head injury, and exposure to industrial toxicants, such as various solvents, or metals, also increase the risk of PD.
